content:
Based on the information provided in your outline, I can infer some of the sources that you may be using. Here are a few that I was able to identify:

* "Road to happiness/ John Reich and Ed Diener"
* "The Science of Happiness"
* TED Talks by Andrew Solomon, Todd B. Kashdan and Robert Biswas-Diener, and Chip Conley
* "Choice, happiness and spaghetti sauce" by Malcolm Gladwell
* "Four pillars of leading to a meaningful life" by Emily Smith

Of course, this is just speculation based on the information provided in your outline, and there may be additional sources that you plan to use that I was not able to identify. It's always a good idea to clearly identify and cite all of the sources you use in your paper to avoid plagiarism and ensure that you are properly crediting the original authors.
